title: Remove old directory structure after refactor
description: Clean up old directory structure after all files have been moved and imports updated. Remove empty core/grid/ and files that have been renamed/consolidated.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Remove core/grid/ directory (should be empty)
- [ ] Remove old core/snapshot.py (merged into visualization.py)
- [ ] Remove old core/world.py (renamed to repository.py)
- [ ] Verify no references to old paths exist
- [ ] Git history preserved (git rm)

title: [S][environment] Microclimate effects
description: Model canopy cooling and shade, add thermal mass from water bodies, implement wind-break benefits, account for albedo differences, and create humidity feedback loops driven by vegetation.

title: [S][ci] the daily run should also update the staging world , but should do so w/ 1-week's worth of steps
[M][spatial] Neighborhood query API
description: Provide Grid helpers for Moore/von Neumann/radius neighborhoods plus caching so repeated lookups during a tick stay fast.
acceptance_criteria: API covers 4- and 8-neighbor cases with tests; caches invalidated per tick; predicate filters supported.

title: [chore][cli] Improve argparse usage in sim.py main

comments.author: david
comments.text: Rebuilt `sim.py` as the single CLI entry point using argparse subparsers. Unknown commands (like legacy `python sim.py prod`) are automatically routed to the `tick` subcommand for backward compatibility.

title: [S][biology] Disturbance-driven succession resets
description: Model fire, overgrazing, flood, and drought disturbance events, ensure they reset succession appropriately, and expose frequency/intensity configuration knobs.

title: [S][environment] Resource pulse responses
description: Detect rainfall events, trigger post-rain growth bursts (especially annuals), model nutrient flushes, add delayed growth responses, and visualize pulse-response spikes.

title: [M][sim] there should be a feedback loop in the main 'tick'
description:
2. Feedback loops (food scarcity affects births) ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Second most important.
Why it matters:

Currently: rabbits multiply regardless of grass availability (unrealistic)
With feedback: starvation when grass runs low ‚Üí population crashes ‚Üí recoveries
Creates boom/bust cycles naturally
Makes the ecosystem feel interconnected

Impact: Turns it from 3 independent exponentials into an actual ecosystem

comments.author: david
comments.text: Scaled rabbit growth to a food-dependent feedback loop: rabbits now reproduce faster when grass easily covers demand and experience starvation losses when grass is scarce. This immediately creates boom/bust behavior in dev tests (see Day 16 snapshot).

title: [S][biology] Climax community stability
description: Define climax detection criteria, lower growth/death rates once climax is reached, allow disturbances to reset succession, track time-to-climax, and support multiple climax archetypes.

title: [S][biology] Resource depletion feedbacks
description: Link biomass to fertility depletion rates, include legacy effects from past biomass, let deep-rooted plants tap special reserves, model pulse-recovery cycles, and document tuning knobs.

title: [S][docs][sim] Rename grass metrics to biomass
description: `GridState.total_grass` and every forecast/sample metric still aggregate all producer guilds under the name "grass", which conflicts with the explicit `fast_grass` guild. Rename those helpers/fields to `total_biomass` (and `Sample.biomass`, `ForecastResult.summary['biomass']`), update CLI output plus README/docs to explain the new terminology, and keep actual fast_grass totals confined to the producer summary table for clarity.

title: [M][biology] Trophic interaction engine
description: Implement probabilistic hunting, pursuit/evasion, competition, and mutualism side effects (seed dispersal, carrion feeds) that tie resource levels to population shifts.
acceptance_criteria: Predation pressure metrics tracked per cell; competition limits populations when resources scarce; facilitation effects (grazers maintaining grass, carrion for scavengers) represented in logs/stats.

title: [M][environment] Temperature gradients + events
description: Implement baseline + seasonal temperature per cell, apply elevation adjustments, and surface discrete cold/heat events that impact growth/mortality.
acceptance_criteria: Temperature scalar available in cell data; producers/consumers read modifiers; events logged to history when thresholds hit.

title: [M][biology] Omnivores + scavengers
description: Model bears and crows with dietary flexibility, carrion consumption, and seed-dispersal/information-spread side effects.
acceptance_criteria: Omnivores dynamically switch diets based on availability; carrion resources decay over time; scavenger presence logged in history.

title: [M][ui] in addition to 'snapshot' should add ui for change over time (will need to consider how to change scale as it grows to not go off screen)
Fix broken herbivore diffusion QA test
description: The herbivore diffusion test in qa_grid_sanity.py:93 is broken due to inverted logic. Since "rabbit" IS in HERBIVORE_SET, the assertion is always skipped and the test passes vacuously.
design: Either update QA tests to reflect that herbivores are now stationary, or implement herbivore-specific movement logic (e.g., water-aware drift as mentioned in patient-world-oeo)
acceptance_criteria: Test properly validates herbivore behavior or is updated to reflect new stationary behavior

title: [S][biology] Carrying capacity enforcement
description: Define per-cell biomass caps, apply logistic slowdowns toward capacity, vary limits by terrain, enforce a hard stop at capacity, and log capacity-limited cells.

title: [S] ONLY prod should ever update the main part of readme, if any other world specified, block
notes: sim.py now blocks --update-readme unless world=prod, ensuring README cannot be mutated by staging/dev runs.

title: [S][biology] Producer fertility uptake mechanics
description: Calculate per-species fertility cost per growth unit, deduct fertility with biomass production, enforce species minimums, represent annual vs perennial depletion, and log severe depletion events.

title: [S][viz] Succession visualization + monitoring
description: Color-code cells by succession stage, plot trajectory over time, show spatial gradients from disturbed to climax, include stage stats in daily summaries, and provide a years-to-climax forecast metric.

title: [M][qa] Spatial ops benchmarking harness
description: Add a benchmark/test harness that stresses repeated neighborhood queries, diffusion, and movements to catch regressions and tune caching.
acceptance_criteria: Harness runs via `sim.py spatial-bench`; baseline metrics recorded in docs/history; CI guard ensures ops stay under defined threshold.

title: [S][biology] Producer species definition + config
description: Create the producer type enum, build a per-species parameter structure, attach emoji + ASCII mappings, and persist species parameters in an external config file.

title: [M][viz] Zoom strategy + perf guardrails
description: Ensure the SVG scales cleanly with natural browser zoom, hide non-critical details until zoomed, and keep generation <1s with diff-friendly output.
acceptance_criteria: CSS/inline styles gate detail levels; perf benchmark documented; Git diff review shows concise changes when few cells update.

title: [M][viz] Environmental layer backgrounds
description: Render background rectangles/gradients for water, fertility, elevation, and temperature with toggles to switch which layer is active.
acceptance_criteria: SVG builder accepts `--layer` flag; colors documented in legend; opacity stacking keeps emoji legible.

title: [S][telemetry] Forecast capacity spam ignores step interval
description: `./sim.py forecast dev --days 365 --step 30 --capacity-report` now emits a capacity log for every simulated day before the actual forecast table. Those `[capacity] Day ‚Ä¶ limited ‚Ä¶` lines come from `core.rules._log_capacity_summary` printing inside every tick, so the forecast command no longer respects the sampling `--step` and can spew hundreds of lines before showing results. The capacity stats should stay in the structured forecast output (table/CSV/JSON) and the per-day debug spam should stay disabled for read-only forecasts.

title: [L][worlds][refactor] Entity-based grid architecture
description: Shift grid simulation from per-cell population counts to independent entity records with migration + tick overhaul. Scope covers adding Entity model, updating cells/state to track IDs, reworking tick/movement logic, adding migration 0002, and ensuring viz/history tooling continues to read derived counts.

title: [M][worlds][model] Implement Entity dataclass
description: Add core/grid/entity.py defining Entity dataclass with id/type/position/hunger/age, from_dict/to_dict helpers, and starvation/death helpers to support future behavior extensions.

title: [M][worlds][refactor] Convert Cell to entity references
description: Refactor core/grid/cell.py so each cell tracks grass + entity_ids list with helpers to add/remove entities and derive rabbit/fox counts via Entity registry for viz and totals.

title: [M][worlds][state] Add entity registry to GridState
description: Extend GridState with entities dict + next_entity_id plus spawn/remove/move helpers and typed cell queries so rest of grid code can manage actors instead of aggregate counts.

title: [L][worlds][simulation] Rewrite tick for entity actors
description: Update tick_grid pipeline plus rabbit/fox logic and diffusion helpers to iterate actual Entity records (hunger, age, movement, reproduction) while keeping viz + totals accurate.

title: [M][migrations] Migration 0002 convert counts to entities
description: Add migration that maps existing per-cell rabbit/fox counts into seeded Entity records with hunger/age ranges, populates entity_ids, sets next_entity_id, and removes aggregate fields.

title: [S][qa][docs] Validate viz + history tooling with entities
description: Ensure cell emojis, snapshot exporter, and README snapshot markers count entities via new helpers, updating docs/tests if necessary so downstream automation keeps working.

title: [M][worlds][movement] Update diffusion for entity actors
description: Redo core/grid/diffusion.py so movement logic pushes individual entity IDs between neighbor cells instead of scaling population counts. Wire helpers that tick_grid can call after entity actions, ensuring per-entity move decisions remain consistent with GridState.move_entity and neighbor lookups.

title: [M][worlds][cleanup] Remove aggregate-only grid code
description: Phase 2 follow-up after entity rollout: strip remaining cell-based rabbit/fox count fields, legacy diffusion math, and dead helper paths so GridState + tick only speak entities. Update docs/tests to reflect entity-only reality.

title: [M][environment] Elevation + topology generation
description: Assign normalized elevation per cell via noise-based generation, feed it into water flow, barriers, and temperature adjustments.
acceptance_criteria: Elevation stored per cell; hydrology + movement respect barriers; doc diagrams show how noise parameters map to terrain types.

title: [L][refactor] update 'commit world' / 'create world' / 'update readme' etc to be under 'commands/' dir, and use argparse SUB parsers ; ./sim.py should be single entry
description: Rebuild sim.py into a lean CLI: single entrypoint with positional world argument, --count/--snapshot/--log/--update-readme flags, and helper core modules (simulation/world/snapshot). Remove command subpackages for now; focus on load‚Üítick‚Üísave flow plus optional side effects. Docs/workflows should reflect simplified usage.

comments.author: david
comments.text: Sim CLI now exposes subcommands (tick/update-readme/commit-world/create-world) registered via argparse, backed by modules in the new commands/ package and shared helpers in world.py. GitHub workflow + docs now call `python sim.py ...` instead of standalone scripts.

title: [S][refactor] Create core/{simulation,world,snapshot}.py modules
description: Move tick logic, world IO, snapshot/README helpers into core/ modules as per simplified CLI plan (load‚Üítick‚Üísave).

title: [M][cli] Simplify sim.py entrypoint
description: Implement the streamlined CLI: positional world (default dev), --count/--snapshot/--log/--update-readme flags, default staging workflow when no args, and direct use of core modules. Remove subcommand complexity.

title: [S][behavior] Wire snapshot/log/readme flags to core helpers
description: Ensure the simplified CLI toggles snapshot generation, history logging, and README updates using the new core modules (including staging auto-detection).

title: [S][docs][automation] Update README/workflow for new CLI structure
description: Refresh README + AGENTS + workflow docs to show ./sim.py default behavior, positional world usage, simplified flag set, and manual instructions aligned with the lean CLI.

title: [M][biology] Producer palatability metadata
description: Add palatability/forage metadata to `ProducerProfile` (e.g., palatability score, forage layer, `preferred_by=['rabbit']`) and replace the hard-coded `RABBIT_DIET` tuple with auto-generated diet tables per herbivore. This ensures rabbits consider every guild (ground vs canopy, moss, reeds, vines, etc.) and sets the stage for future herbivore types under patient-world-c3m.

title: [L][viz] Single-artifact SVG world view
description: Render the entire world state into one zoomable SVG artifact with layered environment/biota overlays and metadata so Git diffing tells the story of each tick.
acceptance_criteria: `docs/world-state.svg` generated alongside prod ticks; layers configurable for environment/populations; legend + timestamp baked into artifact with tests covering SVG builder.

title: [S][viz] Fertility zone visualization + tracking
description: Establish barren/normal/rich thresholds, map them to brown‚Üígreen gradients, add barren cell emoji cues, track transitions over time, and allow intentional barren zone configuration.

title: [L][idea][needs req] add random elements
[S][telemetry] Surface capacity limit summaries in CLI output
description: Extend the "tick" and "forecast" commands so users can see aggregated carrying-capacity pressure. At minimum include a per-run indicator of how many cells hit capacity and the hottest coordinates, with optional flag to dump full stats. Consider wiring capacity summaries into forecast output formats as well.
notes: Telemetry tracker aggregates carrying capacity events and surfaces them via tick/forecast CLI along with new --capacity-report flag; docs updated to explain the output.

title: Rename world.py to repository.py
description: Rename core/world.py to core/repository.py to follow Repository pattern naming.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] git mv core/world.py core/repository.py
- [ ] No code changes to file itself
- [ ] Git history preserved

title: Move GridState to core/model/state.py
description: Move state.py (containing GridState) from core/grid/ to core/model/.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] git mv core/grid/state.py core/model/state.py
- [ ] core/model/__init__.py exports GridState
- [ ] No code changes to state.py itself
- [ ] Git history preserved

title: [XS][migrations] Create initial migration for grid state
description: Add migrations/ directory with a datetime-prefixed script that converts existing prod world JSON to the new grid-aware format (basic distribution logic is acceptable).
notes: Added migrations/20251114_0001_grid_migration.py to convert scalar state files into 10x10 grid schema (backs up original JSON, evenly splits totals across cells).

title: [M][tools] Snapshot diff + branching utilities
description: Ship tooling to diff two checkpoints/snapshots and branch alternate timelines from a saved checkpoint/seed for what-if analysis.
acceptance_criteria: CLI supports `snapshot diff A B`; branching writes to new world folder; docs include tutorial for scenario planning.

title: [S][environment] Water-driven producer zonation
description: Define species water requirement ranges, create biome templates for water bands, implement stress responses, add drought adaptation traits, and map water availability to producer distributions.

title: [S][environment] Fertility gradients and hotspots
description: Generate spatial fertility patterns with valley hotspots, model nutrient redistribution via erosion/droppings/decay, define accumulation zones at congregation sites, detect fertility cliffs, and visualize contours.

title: [S][biology] Succession pathway implementation
description: Model stages from bare ground to climax (pioneer grass, grass dominance, mixed shrub/grass, deep-rooted climax) and expose a succession speed parameter.

title: [M][ops] Intervention logging with CLI support
description: Add an `intervene` subcommand that mutates world state (fields like grass/rabbits/foxes), logs every change to worlds/<world>/interventions.log with timestamp/reason, and saves the new state. Output should summarize the change and log location.

title: [S][cli] Add intervene subcommand to sim.py
description: Implement `sim.py intervene <world> <field> <value> [reason]` to load state, apply additive or absolute adjustments (clamped to >=0), log the change, and save the world.

title: [S][logging] Append interventions.log entries
description: Write interventions to worlds/<world>/interventions.log (timestamp, field, old‚Üínew, quoted reason), ensuring the file is created as needed and stays append-only.

title: [S][docs] Document intervention workflow
description: Update README/AGENTS with the new `sim.py intervene` usage, examples, and guidance on reviewing interventions.log vs git history.

title: [S][qa] Ensure interventions log merge-friendly behavior
description: Make interventions.log easy to audit (plain text, no rewrites) and consider testing scenarios to avoid accidentally mutating history when intervening.

title: [S][ops] Finish intervene logging
description: Extend sim.py intervene to capture timestamped entries with old‚Üínew values and optional reasons, append them to worlds/<world>/interventions.log, and surface the log path to callers.

title: Move cell.py and spatial.py to core/environment/
description: Move cell.py and diffusion.py (renamed to spatial.py) from core/grid/ to core/environment/.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] git mv core/grid/cell.py core/environment/cell.py
- [ ] git mv core/grid/diffusion.py core/environment/spatial.py
- [ ] core/environment/__init__.py exports Cell and diffusion functions
- [ ] No code changes to files themselves
- [ ] Git history preserved

title: [L][sim] Deterministic state + snapshot system
description: Guarantee seeded deterministic runs, add checkpoint/snapshot utilities, and make it easy to diff and branch alternate futures from recorded seeds.
acceptance_criteria: Global RNG usage documented + enforced; regression tests prove identical outputs for same seed; checkpoints can fast-forward dev worlds and diff snapshots via helper CLI.

title: [XS][ci][schedule] Restore daily tick cadence
description: Change .github/workflows/hourly.yml back to a daily cron (12:00 UTC) per original plan while keeping the new snapshot steps intact.

title: [M][movement] Terrain-aware costs + corridors
description: Model traversal costs tied to terrain/environment and detect low-cost migration corridors or barriers for herds and predators.
acceptance_criteria: Cost map derived from environment scalars; corridor detection summarized in history/logs; tests cover boundary + occupied target handling.

title: [S][biology] Multi-species cell storage + visualization
description: Extend Cell to store producer populations by species, enforce biomass capacity limits, compute dominant and secondary species for rendering, and track species richness metrics.

title: help
[S][biology] Competitive pressure dynamics
description: Calculate competition coefficients, suppress slow growers when fast species dominate, encode priority effects, add density-dependent mortality, and support competitive release when dominance shifts.

title: [M][migrations] Versioned migration system
description: Introduce numbered migrations under migrations/ (e.g., 0001_grid_state.py) with the supplied template, add _migration_version field defaulting to 0 in GridState, enforce EXPECTED_VERSION in core/world.py, and document the workflow (usage examples, run-all helper outline) per the Minimal Migration System notes.

title: [S][cli] Add migrate entrypoint to sim.py
description: Extend sim.py so `./sim.py` (default tick) automatically runs pending migrations before ticking, and add an explicit `./sim.py migrate <world>` subcommand that only performs migrations without ticking.

title: [S][environment] Multi-factor limitation model
description: Identify the limiting factor per cell using Liebig‚Äôs law, surface it in visualization, model co-limitation cases, handle seasonal shifts in limiting resources, and produce limitation maps for tuning.

title: [M][viz] Population density overlays
description: Vary emoji size/opacity or numeric overlays based on population counts, showing multi-species cells and disturbance indicators (fire/flood/death).
acceptance_criteria: Renderer scales glyphs with counts; optional numeric overlays appear beyond zoom threshold; special event markers (üî•, üåä, üíÄ) supported.

title: End-to-end verification of ABM refactor
description: Final end-to-end verification that all functionality works after the ABM refactor. Run all CLI commands and scripts to ensure nothing broke.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] sim.py tick runs successfully
- [ ] sim.py forecast runs successfully
- [ ] sim.py init-grid runs successfully
- [ ] sim.py migrate runs successfully
- [ ] scripts/qa_grid_sanity.py passes
- [ ] scripts/commit_world.py works
- [ ] All world operations work (prod, staging, dev)
- [ ] No regressions in functionality

title: [M][sim] Checkpoint + fast-forward pipeline
description: Add checkpoint files that capture whole state plus seed, and expose CLI to fast-forward from checkpoint without replaying intermediate ticks.
acceptance_criteria: `sim.py checkpoint <world>` writes restorable artifact; fast-forward command runs faster than naive loop; README documents workflow.

title: [XS][bug] Growth noise amplitude clamped below requested 10%
description: `core/rules.py::_growth_noise` uses `NOISE_SCALE = 0.04`, which only introduces ¬±4% variation although the biology task calls for ¬±10%. This prevents the intended stochastic swings and makes the reported task incomplete.

title: Consolidate snapshot.py and viz.py into visualization.py
description: Merge core/snapshot.py and core/grid/viz.py into a single core/visualization.py module. This combines snapshot generation and visualization helpers under one clear namespace.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Create core/visualization.py combining snapshot + viz logic
- [ ] All functions from snapshot.py preserved
- [ ] All functions from viz.py preserved
- [ ] No behavior changes
- [ ] Original files can be removed after

title: Move entity.py to core/agents/
description: Move entity.py from core/grid/ to core/agents/ using git mv to preserve history.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] git mv core/grid/entity.py core/agents/entity.py
- [ ] core/agents/__init__.py exports Entity
- [ ] No code changes to entity.py itself
- [ ] Git history preserved

title: [M][biology] Water-cued fox hunting and movement
description: Update fox hunger/reproduction and post-tick diffusion to consider cell water + prey density. Foxes should bias movement toward cooler/wetter cells with abundant rabbits, adjust hunger decay based on local water, and optionally tie spawn/hunting success to rabbit health so predator cycles track abiotic stress. This keeps fox behavior aligned with the new water-aware rabbit dynamics.

title: [S][environment] Fertility recovery dynamics
description: Implement linear recovery, boost rates on bare ground, modulate recovery with water availability, factor in organic matter inputs, and expose rate config parameters.

title: [S][biology] Boom-bust cycle mechanics
description: Track population growth velocity, detect rapid-growth boom conditions tied to fertility drain, trigger bust die-offs when fertility is exhausted, maintain a population floor, and visualize oscillations.

title: [S][biology] Resource-driven growth engine
description: Compute growth via base rate times water/fertility/temp/season/facilitation multipliers with noise, clamp multipliers, and block growth when any factor is too low while keeping profiling under 10% tick time.

title: [M][biology] Herbivore guild behaviors
description: Implement rabbits, grazers, and browsers with hunger/health/reproduction tracking plus herd behavior near food sources.
acceptance_criteria: Each herbivore has diet preferences + emoji; hunger drives movement; herd logic clusters animals around abundant producers.

title: [M][environment] Soil fertility dynamics
description: Model fertility as a scalar affected by producer uptake, slow regeneration, and ties to elevation/water so productive/barren zones emerge.
acceptance_criteria: Fertility influences grass/shrub growth multipliers; depletion + recovery rates tunable; docs explain interplay with elevation/water.

title: [S][environment] Add fertility field to Cell with 0.0-1.0 default 0.5
[S][analytics] Log severe fertility depletion events under 0.2
[S][environment] Implement slow linear fertility recovery rate
[S][environment] Apply bare ground recovery bonus when no producers
[S][environment] Tie fertility recovery to local water availability
[S][environment] Boost recovery via organic matter accumulation from dead plants
[S][sim] Expose fertility recovery rate configuration parameters
[S][environment] Link fertility to elevation so valleys beat peaks
[S][environment] Boost fertility inside floodplain high water zones
[S][environment] Add temperature modifier impacting fertility recovery rate
[S][environment] Model downslope fertility transport via erosion and deposition
[S][environment] Define baseline fertility per biome or elevation zone
[S][docs] Document fertility and environment feedback loops
[S][environment] Define fertility thresholds for barren normal and rich states
[S][viz] Render brown to green gradient based on fertility class
[S][viz] Add desert indicator for persistent barren cells
[S][analytics] Track fertility zone transitions over time
[S][environment] Support intentional barren zone configuration like rocky outcrops
[S][environment] Implement fertility persistence and initialization flow
[S][environment] Clamp fertility range with validation guards
[S][analytics] Track fertility change rate per tick for debugging
[S][biology] Calculate fertility cost per producer type per growth unit
[S][biology] Deduct fertility proportional to biomass production
[S][biology] Block growth when fertility drops below species minimum
[S][biology] Support differential depletion between annuals and perennials
Add capacity clamping before growth calculations
description: Capacity is enforced after growth calculations, meaning producers can temporarily exceed caps during the tick. This might cause subtle bugs if other systems read cell state mid-tick.
design: Apply logistic growth curves that asymptote at capacity (like _crowding_penalty()) instead of post-hoc correction
acceptance_criteria: Producer growth naturally respects capacity limits without requiring post-growth clamping

title: [S] add staging section to README at bottom should include the staging world (w/ preface that the days are not real)
[M][spatial] Coordinate + boundary handling
description: Lock in (x, y) indexing, axis orientation, and boundary conditions (wrap vs. hard edge) with unit tests covering corner cases.
acceptance_criteria: Sim tick respects configured boundary strategy; README/vision note conventions; invalid coordinates raise consistent errors.

title: Update fox predation for multi-herbivore system
description: Fox predation still uses old aggregate logic that only targets rabbits. It doesn't integrate with new herbivore health/water stress or multi-herbivore diet preferences (grazers vs browsers).
design: Update fox predation to consider all herbivore types, their health/stress levels, and potentially prefer weaker prey
acceptance_criteria: Fox predation works with all herbivore types and considers their condition when selecting prey

title: [M][persistence] Grid serialization + resizing
description: Teach load/save routines to round-trip the new Grid/Cell structures, including variable grid dimensions without breaking snapshots.
acceptance_criteria: `state.json` persists via Grid helpers; dev command proves resizing works; migration notes added for existing worlds.

title: [S][ci] the daily run should also update the staging world , but should do so w/ 1-week's worth of steps
notes: CI workflow now runs prod tick daily and staging tick with --count 7 each scheduled run, committing both worlds sequentially. Manual dispatch remains available for ad-hoc worlds.

title: [M][spatial] Resource diffusion + gradients
description: Implement single-pass diffusion for water/fertility scalars plus gradient helpers (uphill/downhill) to inform hydrology and movement decisions.
acceptance_criteria: Diffusion is tunable per resource; gradients exposed via helper; profiling shows tick time impact documented.

title: [XS][bug] Producer summary never updated in forecast output
description: `core/analysis.py` initializes `producer_summary` but never updates it inside the forecast loop because the update block was accidentally left at the bottom of the file. As a result the "Producer guilds" summary always shows the initial biomass. Move the update logic into the loop so each guild tracks min/max/extinction days correctly.

title: [S][biology] Colonization mechanics
description: Implement per-species dispersal radii, enforce minimum water/fertility for establishment, add probability gates, support seed banks after disturbance, and log colonization events with source tracking.

title: [S][environment] Environmental memory and adaptation
description: Track per-cell environmental history (drought, flood), adjust species composition using that history, model legacy effects, support adaptive shifts toward tolerant species, and document the memory window.

title: [M][environment] Seasonal + photoperiod drivers
description: Add four-season cycle with gradual transitions, track day length, and expose modifiers for water, temperature, growth, and migration triggers.
acceptance_criteria: Season + day length stored globally; CLI shows current season; species/environment scalars respond smoothly to transitions.

title: Update all imports for new ABM structure
description: Update all Python imports across the codebase to reflect the new ABM structure. This is the integration step that wires everything together after files have been moved.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Update all imports in sim.py
- [ ] Update all imports in core/ modules
- [ ] Update all imports in scripts/
- [ ] Update all imports in migrations/
- [ ] All tests/QA scripts run successfully
- [ ] No import errors anywhere

title: [XL][biology] Expand trophic dynamics
description: Introduce diverse producer and consumer guilds with resource-driven behaviors, competition, and mutualism effects to unlock emergent ecological patterns.
acceptance_criteria: Multiple producer + herbivore + carnivore archetypes implemented; trophic interactions respond to environment/resource availability; README and docs describe new food web behaviors.

title: [L][worlds][refactor] Multi-world state management overhaul
description: Move to worlds/<name>/ state/history/snapshot layout, change sim.py to take positional world names, update update_readme.py + workflow, add helper script, and migrate prod/dev data.

title: [M][sim][worlds] Rework sim.py for positional world arguments
description: Replace --prod/--dev flags with positional world names, create worlds/<name>/ structure, update file paths, ensure directories/history init, and keep --snapshot support.

title: [S][script][docs] Update README + update_readme.py for worlds/prod snapshots
description: Read snapshot from worlds/prod/snapshot.md (configurable later) and document the new worlds directory scheme and commands.

title: [S][ci][workflow] Adjust GitHub Action for worlds/prod layout
description: Update the daily workflow to run python sim.py prod --snapshot and commit worlds/prod/* plus README changes.

title: [S][repo][migration] Move existing prod/dev assets into worlds/
description: Create worlds/prod with state/history/snapshot, add worlds/dev (gitignored) structure, migrate state_prod.json and history.csv, and clean up old root files/gitignore.

comments.author: david
comments.text: Initialized long-lived `staging` world via `python create_world.py staging`, ran a tick + snapshot, and confirmed README updates can target `worlds/staging/`.

title: [XS][script][helper] create_world.py bootstrap tool
description: Optional script to initialize new worlds and optionally copy from an existing world (e.g., python create_world.py staging-v2 --from=prod).

title: [S][docs][gitignore] Update ignorables + README migration notes
description: Clean up .gitignore entries for old state files/history/snapshot, document migration/testing steps in README, and note the new directory structure.

title: [XS][ci][staging] Manual workflow trigger for staging world
description: Extend the daily workflow (workflow_dispatch) to accept a world input (default prod) so maintainers can run python sim.py <world> --snapshot for staging on demand.

title: [S][biology] Producer coexistence mechanics
description: Define niche separation, competitive exclusion handling, facilitation effects, support for stable mixed communities, and logging of species turnover events.

title: Activate multi-herbivore spawning
description: Grazers and browsers are defined in herbivore profiles but not spawned in the initial world. Only rabbits are currently spawning.
design: Update world initialization to spawn multiple herbivore types (rabbits, grazers, browsers) with appropriate population distributions
acceptance_criteria: Initial world contains multiple herbivore species as defined in HERBIVORE_PROFILES

title: [M][spatial] Cell data schema
description: Define a `Cell` structure that tracks per-species populations, environmental scalars, and temporal metadata with an extension hook for future traits.
acceptance_criteria: Cell object validated during load/save; supports property access instead of raw dicts; docs describe available attributes.

title: [XL][environment] Build abiotic environmental layer
description: Model per-cell environmental scalars (water, fertility, elevation, temperature) plus temporal drivers (seasons, weather, hydrology) so organisms react to abiotic change.
acceptance_criteria: Environmental state persisted with worlds; seasonal/weather cycles update scalars each tick; hedging docs describe how abiotic values influence growth/movement.

title: [M][environment] Environmental-Biology Coupling
description: Connect environmental scalars to producer and consumer behaviors with explicit feedback loops.

Replace hardcoded RABBIT_DIET with profile lookup
description: The hardcoded RABBIT_DIET constant in core/rules.py:26 contradicts the HerbivoreProfile.diet in herbivores.py. This means new grazers/browsers will use rabbit diet instead of their profile's diet.
design: Replace module constant with profile lookup in _graze function to use profile.diet for each herbivore type
acceptance_criteria: Each herbivore type uses its own diet from HERBIVORE_PROFILES instead of hardcoded RABBIT_DIET

title: [M][sim] Seed propagation + replay metadata
description: Persist per-tick seed lineage (base seed, derived seeds per phase) so historical runs can be replayed exactly from any tick.
acceptance_criteria: History CSV/log captures seeds; replay command accepts tick + seed to regenerate identical outcome; docs outline workflow.

title: [M][environment] Water availability system
description: Store per-cell water scalars with history, tie water to producer growth and movement heuristics, and expose üíß visualization hooks.
acceptance_criteria: Water values persisted + clamped 0-1; producers read water limiter; visual overlay or stats reflect water level.

title: [S][biology] Add waterlogging penalties when water exceeds tolerance
[S][docs] Document water and growth coupling inside species configuration
[S][behavior] Factor water availability into herbivore attractiveness scoring

[S][behavior] Trigger migrations when home cells hit water scarcity thresholds

[M][spatial] Canonical Grid container
description: Build a `Grid` class that owns cell storage, exposes coordinate helpers, and becomes the single entry point for reading/writing world state during ticks.
acceptance_criteria: Grid API replaces ad-hoc dict access across sim loop; includes unit tests for coordinate translation and iteration order.

title: [S][biology] Species traits + tradeoffs
description: Capture fast grass, slow shrub, deep-rooted, and seasonal annual trait constants and document the r/K tradeoff rationale.

title: [S][analytics] Water stats in tick + forecast outputs
description: Expose per-day water aggregates (mean/min/max and dry cell counts) during tick runs and forecast simulations so CLI output shows a meaningful number tied to the new water system.

title: [S][biology] Producer water coupling rules
description: Create water limiter multipliers for producer growth, record species-specific requirements, model drought stress, add waterlogging penalties, and document the coupling in species config.

title: Update documentation for ABM structure
description: Update all documentation to reflect the new ABM architecture structure. This includes Basic Memory notes, AGENTS.md, and creating a changelog entry.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Update docs/architecture/Core & CLI with new structure
- [ ] Update AGENTS.md with new import paths
- [ ] Add changelog entry for ABM refactor
- [ ] Update any diagrams or references to old structure
- [ ] README still accurate

title: [chore][env] Document venv usage and setup
[S][environment] Fertility-environment coupling
description: Link fertility to elevation, boost floodplains, add temperature modifiers, implement downslope transport, and document the feedback loops.

title: [M][snapshot][automation] README Snapshot Publishing Epic
description: Automate generating a world snapshot from sim.py, writing it to README via update script, and wiring it into the daily workflow and local tooling.

title: [S][sim][snapshot] Implement snapshot generator + CLI flag
description: Add the generate_snapshot helper and --snapshot flag in sim.py, writing snapshots to snapshot.md when invoked alongside dev/prod ticks.

title: [S][script][docs] Create snapshot update script + README markers
description: Add update_readme.py that replaces content between <!-- SNAPSHOT START/END --> and seed README.md with the snapshot block placeholder.

title: [S][ci][automation] Wire snapshot + README updates into daily workflow
description: Run python sim.py --prod --snapshot, invoke update_readme.py, and commit README/state/history/snapshot outputs inside .github/workflows/daily.yml.

title: [XS][repo][gitignore] Track snapshot artifact expectations
description: Add snapshot.md to .gitignore (alongside state_dev.json) so local runs don't dirty the tree while Actions commits the prod snapshot copy.

title: [S][testing][docs] Document local snapshot testing steps
description: Capture the manual flow for running python sim.py --dev --snapshot, inspecting snapshot.md, updating README via update_readme.py, and reverting changes for dry runs.

title: [M][environment] Weather + hydrology events
description: Simulate rainfall, evaporation, and downhill redistribution so water moves realistically (storm fronts, rain shadows, floods, droughts).
acceptance_criteria: Weather scheduler drives spatial rainfall events; evaporation tied to temperature; redistribution step fills basins and supports flooding rules.

title: Create new directory structure skeleton
description: Create empty directories and __init__.py files for the new ABM structure. No code moves yet, just scaffolding.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] core/agents/ exists with __init__.py
- [ ] core/environment/ exists with __init__.py
- [ ] core/model/ exists with __init__.py
- [ ] scripts/ exists at root
- [ ] experiments/ exists at root
- [ ] All __init__.py files are empty initially

title: [M][viz] Core SVG renderer
description: Build generator that renders 64x64 grid into `docs/world-state.svg` with configurable cell size, grouping, and emoji mapping.
acceptance_criteria: Command `sim.py render-svg` writes artifact under 1s; README references output; tests cover a few cells for layout sanity.

title: Split tick.py into scheduler.py and rules.py
description: Split core/grid/tick.py into two files: core/scheduler.py (orchestration) and core/rules.py (behavior logic). The scheduler calls rules, rules contain the actual simulation logic.
design:
Extract behavior logic from tick.py into rules.py:
- Movement/diffusion logic
- Feeding/predation logic  
- Reproduction logic
- Mortality/starvation logic

Leave tick_grid in scheduler.py to orchestrate rule execution.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] core/scheduler.py created with tick_grid function
- [ ] tick_grid orchestrates rule execution
- [ ] All behavior logic extracted to rules.py
- [ ] Original tick.py logic preserved, just reorganized
- [ ] No behavior changes

title: [L][grid] Phase 1 spatial grid simulation
description: Phase 1 moves every world to the new GridState architecture: clean break to per-cell data, core/grid modules (state, cell, tick, diffusion, viz), CLI commands that only operate on grids, snapshot/forecast wiring, world init helpers, and migration tooling so prod/staging never see dual formats.

title: [M][state] Extend world state to include grid cells
description: Stand up core/grid/{__init__,state,cell}.py with GridState + Cell classes, JSON (de)serialization, coordinate helpers, totals/clone utilities, and validation that rejects legacy state.

title: [S][cli] Grid-aware intervene command
description: Update ./sim.py intervene flow to load GridState, apply global deltas across cells (and prep for --at x,y), and log/save using new totals.

title: [M][migration] One-time grid converter
description: Add migrate.py that reads legacy state.json, builds grid-sized cells, scatters animals, backups the old file, and saves GridState so prod/staging/dev share the new format.

title: [S][docs] Document grid-only architecture + migration
description: Update README/docs to describe GridState schema, init-grid usage, migration steps, and remove references to legacy aggregate world format.

title: [S][cli] Grid initialization command
description: Add ./sim.py init-grid <world> CLI plus world.init_grid_world helper so every environment can be seeded with deterministic width/height and initial population scatter.

title: [L][tick] Per-cell interactions without diffusion
description: Implement tick.tick_cell + tick_grid using per-cell rules (grass growth, rabbit/fox predation, reproduction/starvation, rounding/clamping) and wire sim.py tick/runloop to call them.

title: [M][tick] Basic diffusion between neighboring cells
description: Add core/grid/diffusion.py that spreads rabbits/foxes to N/S/E/W neighbors post-tick with configurable rates, and toggleable pipeline hook for Phase 2.

title: [S][metrics] Derive aggregate totals from grid
description: Expose total_grass/rabbits/foxes helpers plus aggregation utilities so tick/logging/snapshot/forecast can rely on GridState-derived totals.

title: [S][viz] Render 10√ó10 README grid (Phase 1)
description: Implement core/grid/viz.py + snapshot.generate_snapshot to render emoji grids (ü¶ä/üêá/üå≤/üå±/‚ñ´Ô∏è) and totals in README snapshots.

title: [M][forecast] Update projection CLI for grid state
description: Update core/analysis.py + forecast CLI to clone GridState, reuse tick_grid (and later diffusion), and report aggregates across table/csv/json outputs.

title: [S][qa] Sanity checks for grid tick
description: Add smoke tests or CLI validation (e.g., deterministic seeds, conservation bounds) to ensure grid tick/diffusion stay sane before prod rollout.

title: [M][world] Grid-only load/save + init helper
description: Rewrite core/world.py to load/save GridState only (error if grid keys missing), add init_grid_world builder used by CLI, and ensure history/snapshot helpers work with totals from GridState.

title: [M][viz] Metadata + legend block
description: Embed legend, timestamp/day number, season, population totals, and grid coordinate labels in the SVG for quick interpretation.
acceptance_criteria: Legend explains emoji/colors; metadata auto-updates each tick; coordinates labeled at regular intervals without clutter.

title: [L][qa] forecast cli option to test changes over time
description: Add a read-only `forecast` CLI command that simulates future ticks without mutating state. Supports --days, --step, optional seeds, and multiple output formats (table/csv/json) for QA/analysis. Integrate into sim.py (tick command remains default), provide killer examples, and document usage.
notes: Forecast CLI shipped with read-only projections, sampling, seed control, and documentation.

title: [S][cli] Add forecast subcommand to sim.py
description: Introduce `sim.py forecast` accepting world/days/step/seed/format options, wiring it to read-only simulation loops without mutating state.
notes: Forecast subcommand added to sim.py with proper argument parsing and backward-compatible tick defaults.

title: [M][logic] Implement forecast engine (sampling & stats)
description: Use core simulation logic to project ahead (days/step/seed), gather samples, detect extinctions, and compute summary stats for grass/rabbits/foxes.
notes: Implemented forecast engine with sampling, optional seed noise, extinction tracking, and summaries.

title: [S][output] Support table/csv/json forecast formats
description: Render forecast output in CLI table form plus optional csv/json serialization, including extinction warnings and summaries.
notes: Marking as icebox: forecast outputs default to table for now; csv/json can be picked up later once core forecasting proves valuable.

comments.author: david
comments.text: Icebox: table output covers current needs; revisit csv/json export when QA workflows demand it.

title: [S][docs][qa] Document forecast usage and examples
description: Update README/AGENTS with forecast command guidance and include QA workflows (before/after comparisons, extinction detection, csv export).
notes: README/AGENTS updated with forecast usage examples, QA tips, and CLI instructions.

title: [chore][ci] Extract workflow commit logic into script
[S][telemetry][docs] Fauna water stress logging
description: Once rabbits/foxes respond to water, add telemetry to capture water-stress events (similar to the capacity tracker) and surface them via CLI/docs. Update README + `docs/vision/Producer Guilds.md` to explain the biomass terminology change and how water limits herbivore health so QA can track the new coupling. Cross-reference patient-world-c3m so downstream work reuses the telemetry hooks.

title: Restructure to ABM architecture pattern
description: Reorganize core/ directory to follow Agent-Based Model (ABM) + Repository Pattern conventions. This is a pure refactor - no feature additions, no class/function renames, minimal code changes. Goal is improved clarity and maintainability through standard ABM directory structure.
design:
## Target Structure

```
core/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ __init__.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agents/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ __init__.py
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ entity.py        # from grid/entity.py
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ base.py          # placeholder for future
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ environment/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ __init__.py
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cell.py          # from grid/cell.py
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ grid.py          # from grid/state.py (rename file only)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ spatial.py       # from grid/diffusion.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ model/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ __init__.py
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ state.py         # from grid/state.py (GridState class)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ rules.py             # extract from grid/tick.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scheduler.py         # from grid/tick.py (tick_grid orchestration)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ repository.py        # from world.py
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ visualization.py     # from snapshot.py + grid/viz.py
```

Top-level changes:
```
scripts/                 # NEW directory
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ commit_world.py      # move from root
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ qa_grid_sanity.py    # move from root

experiments/             # NEW directory (empty for now)
```

## Principles
- NO feature additions
- NO class/function renames
- Preserve all existing behavior
- Update imports only
- Keep git history clean with git mv
- Single files initially (rules.py, not rules/)
- Multi-file modules stay multi-file (grid/ splits into agents/, environment/)

## Acceptance Criteria
- All tests/QA scripts pass
- sim.py works unchanged (except imports)
- Git history preserved via git mv
- No behavior changes
- Documentation updated
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All existing functionality works
- [ ] sim.py runs all subcommands successfully
- [ ] qa_grid_sanity.py passes
- [ ] All imports updated correctly
- [ ] Git history clean (using git mv)
- [ ] AGENTS.md updated with new structure
- [ ] docs/architecture/Core & CLI updated

title: Implement water-aware herbivore movement
description: Herbivores are currently completely stationary after the PR removed diffusion. The linked issue patient-world-oeo mentions extending apply_entity_diffusion to factor per-cell water/temperature so herbivores drift toward favorable microclimates.
design: Implement herbivore-specific movement logic that considers water levels and temperature when determining drift direction. Could be as simple as 'drift toward higher water' initially.
acceptance_criteria: Herbivores move based on environmental conditions (water/temperature) rather than being completely stationary

title: [S][simulation] Water-aware diffusion bias
description: Extend `apply_entity_diffusion` (and any movement helpers) to factor per-cell water/temperature so herbivores/predators drift toward favorable microclimates rather than random neighbors. This plumbing should expose hooks the water-aware rabbit/fox tasks use and align with the herd-behavior epic (patient-world-c3m).

title: [S][environment] Fertility scalar model
description: Add a 0.0-1.0 fertility field to Cell with biome/elevation baselines, persist and initialize it, clamp values, and track per-tick change rates for debugging.

title: [s][agents] create basic memory note under docs/agents/ for how to add changelog for any 'epic' from beads
notes: Added docs/agents/Changelog Playbook via Basic Memory describing how to log completed epics under docs/changelog/ using bm + template guidance.

title: [S][viz] Water availability visualization hooks
description: Map water levels to blue intensity, overlay droplet icons on saturated cells, add an SVG water layer toggle, build a dedicated heatmap mode, and include mean/min/max/dry stats in the daily summary.

title: [L][spatial] Advanced neighborhood + movement ops
description: Implement efficient neighborhood queries, diffusion mechanics, and movement primitives so ticks can reason about local context, flow, and bulk movement without ad-hoc helpers scattered throughout the sim.
acceptance_criteria: Moore/von Neumann/radius lookups exposed on grid API; diffusion + flow hooks run in a distinct tick phase; movement manager orchestrates relocations and enforces constraints/tests.

title: [M][biology] Extended producer guild roster
description:
Expand the vegetation subsystem beyond the initial four guilds so the simulation tracks diverse ground + canopy producers.

Scope includes:
- add new producer profiles (wetlands, desert, climbers, pioneer shrubs) with emojis + growth traits
- adjust seeding/init to populate all guilds and clamp layers dynamically
- ensure ticks, logs, and forecasts surface per-guild totals and docs describe the expanded roster
- update QA fixtures so the new species participate in regression runs

title: [XS][migrations] Move migrate helper under migrations/
description: Relocate migrate.py into migrations/ with a timestamped filename (20251115_0001_grid_migration.py), adjust README/docs references, and keep backups behavior identical.

title: [S][ops] Normalize history logs to UTC ISO timestamps
description: Update world.log_history (and any other writers) to emit ISO8601 UTC timestamps, then rewrite worlds/prod/history.csv and worlds/staging/history.csv so existing entries follow the same format.

title: [XL][spatial] Strengthen core grid substrate
description: Formalize the grid container and cell model so every world tick shares the same coordinate, storage, and serialization rules. Cover boundary handling, variable sizing, and the data structures that hold population/environment metadata per cell.
acceptance_criteria: Grid behavior and persistence flow documented in docs/vision; Grid + Cell abstractions own all state transitions; scheduler order guarantees captured in code comments/tests.

title: Move utility scripts to scripts/ directory
description: Move commit_world.py and qa_grid_sanity.py from root into scripts/ directory to declutter the top level.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] git mv commit_world.py scripts/commit_world.py
- [ ] git mv qa_grid_sanity.py scripts/qa_grid_sanity.py
- [ ] Update any references in docs/AGENTS.md
- [ ] Verify scripts still work from new location
- [ ] Git history preserved

title: [M][sim] Tick scheduler + documentation
description: Create a scheduler abstraction that enforces environment‚Üíproducer‚Üíconsumer‚Üímovement‚Üícleanup ordering, lets phases be skipped/mocked, and documents the rationale.
acceptance_criteria: Scheduler unit tests cover ordering guarantees; Dev doc outlines each phase; config flag can disable phases for testing.

title: [M][biology] Multi-layer producer guilds
description: Introduce fast grass, slow shrubs, deep-rooted plants, and seasonal annuals per cell with coexistence rules and emoji mapping.
acceptance_criteria: Each producer type has growth params + visual symbol; cells can host multiple producers; docs explain tradeoffs.

description: Incorporate water availability into herbivore attractiveness scores, detect high-water gathering points, trigger migration when scarcity hits, add seasonal water memory, and log water-driven movements.

description: Model carrying capacity, resource-tied growth modifiers, competitive pressure, and succession from bare ground to climax communities.
acceptance_criteria: Growth uses water/fertility/temp/season inputs; succession transitions logged; tests cover boom-bust + disturbance reset scenarios.

acceptance_criteria: Single RNG module accepted across codebase; seeds configurable via CLI + config; docs explain deterministic usage with examples.

title: Add explicit migration v3 for producer system
description: The current implicit migration works but is dangerous for production. Once you save state with new schema, rollback becomes impossible. Need explicit migration version tracking.
design: Create migrations/0003_producers_and_water.py to convert grass ‚Üí producers + add environment fields. Update EXPECTED_MIGRATION_VERSION = 3. Test on staging before prod.
acceptance_criteria: Explicit migration exists, version tracking works, and production can safely upgrade with rollback capability

title: [L][qa] cli option to test changes over time
description:
Scenario: days=365, step=30, seed=42
Initial: day=0 grass=1000 rabbits=30 foxes=5

Day    Grass   Rabbits  Foxes
0      1000    30       5
30     870     22       4
60     950     18       3
90     1100    25       4
...

Summary:
  Grass   start=1000 end=1120 min=520  max=1500
  Rabbits start=30   end=18   min=0    max=46   extinct_days=10
  Foxes   start=5    end=3    min=0    max=8    extinct_days=0

title: [M][biology] Water-aware rabbit physiology
description: Rework `tick_rabbits` so hunger/reproduction integrate both water availability and the revised producer metadata. Use `Cell.get_water()` / `cell.water_average()` to scale grazing efficiency and hunger decay (drought cells reduce nutrition, wet cells ease hunger), and compute nutrition via per-guild palatability instead of the flat `_graze(..., amount=6)` call. Goal: rabbits respond to moss/reeds/succulents differently and their reproduction thresholds incorporate water stress.

title: [M][qa] Determinism regression suite
description: Add a test harness that runs the same tick twice with identical seeds and asserts byte-for-byte equality on state/history/snapshot outputs.
acceptance_criteria: CI job fails on non-deterministic changes; fixtures kept lightweight; failure triage guide added to docs/agents/.

title: [S][environment] Core water mechanics scaffolding
description: Implement the base 0.0-1.0 water scalar, add per-cell storage helpers, maintain a rolling average window, persist the water field in world state, and seed new worlds with a noise-based distribution.

title: Remove orphaned HERBIVORE_SET definition
description: Dead code in scripts/qa_grid_sanity.py:143 defines HERBIVORE_SET after the module exits with raise SystemExit(main())
acceptance_criteria: Remove the orphaned HERBIVORE_SET definition after the SystemExit line
